intro: Ferulago contracta, commonly known as the narrowleaf ferulago, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly aromatic scent, while its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its natural distribution.
